english: after eating one’s fill; be full from a meal; having just eaten

etymology.description: 吃饱 (eat to fullness) + 了 (perfective) + 饭 (meal) = having already eaten one’s fill of a meal.
etymology.interpretation: Colloquial resultative pattern indicating the action of eating has reached satiety and is completed. 饭 is an afterposed object naming the meal following a resultative complement.
etymology.simplification: 饱(飽) and 饭(飯) simplify the food radical from 飠 to 饣 and reduce strokes; 吃 and 了 are unchanged.

parts.english: eat to fullness;eat one’s fill;be stuffed;have enough to eat

examples.chinese: 我们吃饱了饭(我們吃飽了飯)再出发(再出發)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen chī bǎo le fàn zài chūfā.
examples.english: After we’ve eaten our fill, we’ll set off.

examples.chinese: 他中午吃饱了饭(他中午吃飽了飯)，就去开会(就去開會)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhōngwǔ chī bǎo le fàn, jiù qù kāihuì.
examples.english: After eating his fill at noon, he went to the meeting.

examples.chinese: 你先吃饱了饭(你先吃飽了飯)，再说工作(再說工作)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiān chī bǎo le fàn, zài shuō gōngzuò.
examples.english: Eat your fill first, then talk about work.
